topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5459732263687258ee990100#post_5459732263687258ee990100
And don't get me started on those hacks who just go stabbity stab in broad daylight in front of witnesses and get caught right away- that's the equivalent of shitting on a canvas and calling it art. A real artist doesn't get caught. Or those attention-whoring assholes who use bombs- they just do it for the shock value.

[bq="PaskaNaakka"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5459724d636872738c160000#post_5459724d636872738c160000
I think psychic murders would be a bit like digital art, compared to the traditional art of the old-fashioned murders.

Really, murder is an underrated art form. People can't seem to appreciate all the grueling preparation and planning it takes.[/bq]

I like this guy

topics.body:
Did it! I gitted gud at bayonetta 1!
I'm actually enjoying it now! This game is still freaking brutal compared to bayo 2 though. The item and death penalties are murder and chaining together combos isn't nearly as smooth. I also like bayo 2's art better as well. The first one just seems so drab most of the time. 

[spoiler]also bayo pulls off d'arc way better than Jeanne does[/spoiler]
